required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the MedWise Risk Score™ (MWRS™), a holistic approach to quantifying the risk of a patient's medication regimen. High risk patients will be identified at hospital discharge. Targeted interventions will be made to reduce their MWRS™ with a 30-day follow up. The hypothesis being tested is that a reduction in MWRS™ will lead to reduced 30-day readmission.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of individuals with an emergency department visit or hospital readmission
primary_outcome.description: Number of individuals with an emergency department visit or hospital readmission

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in score between patients aged older and younger than 65 years

arm_group.description: Discharge medication regimen instructions will be provided upon discharge after being assessed using the MWRS, optimized, and assessed by the prescriber.
Discharge medication regimen instructions will be provided upon discharge after being assessed by the prescriber.

intervention.description: Targeted interventions based off of risk score software

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospital admission for at least 48 hours
- Prescribed at least 5 medications at hospital discharge
- Baseline medication risk score of 20 or more
Exclusion Criteria:
- Reside greater than 25 miles from the index facility
- Discharge to hospice
- Discharge against medical advice
- Patient expiration during initial hospitalization

facility.name: Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital Somerset

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results in publications, after deidentification (text, tables, figures, and appendices) will be shared.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data will be shared with investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved. Proposals should be directed to brunetti@rutgers.edu.
